H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4393.def: = a certain quantity that fill a certain container

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7110.def: = process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

glosses: (someone with a) split, disfigured (ear, nose, or lip)
H2763.def: = state in which an object is (partly or entirely) split into two parts

H2874.def: = causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H889.def: = process by which dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H6297.def: = body of an animal or human that has died or been killed; ► source of pollution and impurity

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H4549.def: = process by which substances become soft, ◄ often as a result of  a higher temperature

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H4743.def: = process by which wounds or parts of the human body decompose

H1556.def: = causative action by which humans cause an object to move by turning it over and over

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H5929.def: = one of the expanded, usually green structures growing from the stem of a plant; ► providing shade; ≈ associated with life when green, but known to wither when disconnected from the plant and therefore also denoting the fragility of life

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H2764.def: = long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H1878.def: = process by which the human body accumulates fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well-being

H2459.def: = fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

H3733.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a young male sheep

H6260.def: = dominant male goat in a {L:צֹאן<SDBH:צֹאן>}; ≈ associated with authority

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H1224.def: = area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

H2874.def: = causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H7214.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a wild, untamable animal with horns, and very strong; perhaps wild ox, buffalo, or rhinoceros; ≈ symbol of strength, wildness, and power

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H6499.def: = young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H47.def: = male bovine; ≈ symbol of deities and associated with power and strength, but also with aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H1878.def: = process by which the human body accumulates fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well-being

H2459.def: = fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H2203.def: = tarlike substance, ◄ naturally derived from petroleum, ► and used to make objects watertight

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H1614.def: = a pale yellow substance which burns readily in air; ◄ it is found in regions of volcanic activity such as the Dead Sea area, and ► causes the land to be infertile; ≈ it is  associated with punishment from God

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3518.def: = process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2717.def: = process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H6893.def: exact meaning unsure: = relatively small black bird; ► unclean; ≈ associated with loneliness, devastation, destruction, and possibly death

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H3244.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: type of owl with a mottled gray-brown color; its eyes are outlined with pale circles, so that it looks as though it is wearing spectacles; it prefers wooded areas or orchards and roosts close to the trunk of a tree; ◄ Strix aluco; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H6158.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H6957.def: = line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H922.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order; ≈ used exclusively in a word pair together with its rhyming synonym {L:תֹּהוּ<SDBH:תֹּהוּ>}

36.gl: to stretch the plummet of chaos over (something) > to reduce (something) to chaos

26.gl: to stretch out a measuring line

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2715.def: = empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H4410.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H759.def: = building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H7057.def: = thorny plant ► considered to be a weed; ≈ associated with neglect and desolation

H2336.def: = plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H2681.def: = perennial vegetable, with oblong shaped bulb; member of the lily family, |iAllium porrum|i*; ► may serve as food; ≈ much appreciated

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3284.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H6728.def: = boat of a relatively large size; ► able to sail the sea and ocean

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6298.def: = process by which humans, animals, or deities come upon other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another, either or not expectedly; these encounters may be peaceful or result in aggression depending on the nature or intentions of one or both parties

H338.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H8163.def: = a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H3917.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly another name for the {L:tawny owl<SDBH:יַנְשֹׁוף>}, or: = type of owl with tiny ears that is a mottled gray in color; by day it perches close to the trunk of a tree, where its mottled coloring blends in with the tree bark, making the owl look like the stump of a broken branch; it has a soft, trilled call; ≈ associated with demons

H7280.def: literally: until I will wink; hence: = state in which an event lasts for a very short length of time

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4494.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H7077.def: = causative action by which birds build a {L:nest<SDBH:קֵן>}; ◄ with the help of twigs, straw, grass and other materials, ► as a place where they can lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H1716.def: = to sit upon eggs for a prolonged period ► in order to provide the warmth that is needed for the eggs to hatch at the proper time

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H1772.def: exact meaning unknown, possibly: = dark brown bird with a grayish head and a long triangular tail that looks V-shaped as it maneuvers the two outer feathers; ◄ Milvus migrans; ► it feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and food scraps from human dwellings, and scavenges dead fish and shellfish along the beaches of oceans, lakes, and rivers; they also pick off small bits of meat from animal carcasses; unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H7468.def: literally: striving after wind; hence: = action by which humans are actively looking to be engaged in activities that serve no purpose

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H7468.def: literally: striving after wind; hence: = action by which humans are actively looking to be engaged in activities that serve no purpose

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H6957.def: = line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
